Sentencas: Nanocrystalline scandia-doped zirconia (ScSZ) ceramics with a relative density of above 96% and an average grain size of similar to 80 nm were prepared via pressureless sintering at 900 degrees C for 4 h in air.
Titulo: Low temperature processing of dense nanocrystalline scandia-doped zircoma (ScSZ) ceramics

Sentencas: The starting powder synthesized by co-precipitation combined with supercritical fluid drying route is highly homogeneous and weakly agglomerated with crystallite size about 3 nm and specific surface area of 378 m(2)/g, and can be uniaxially pressed into highly homogeneous compacts.
Titulo: Low temperature processing of dense nanocrystalline scandia-doped zircoma (ScSZ) ceramics

Sentencas: The excellent sinterability achieved in this work is mainly attributed to the small crystallite size with high surface area and the weak agglomeration.
Titulo: Low temperature processing of dense nanocrystalline scandia-doped zircoma (ScSZ) ceramics

Sentencas: The very low sintering temperature achieved in the present work is of practical significance for suppressing the cubic phase to beta-phase transition to some degree, eliminating the discontinuity in electrical conductivity and facilitating co-firing the ZrO2-based electrolytes with other SOFCs (solid oxide fuel cells) components.
Titulo: Low temperature processing of dense nanocrystalline scandia-doped zircoma (ScSZ) ceramics
Low temperature processing of dense nanocrystalline scandia-doped zircoma (ScSZ) ceramics
Low temperature processing of dense nanocrystalline scandia-doped zircoma (ScSZ) ceramics
